articles.author: Paritosh Bansal
articles.description: The U.S. bond market is calling a moment: the age of low interest rates and inflation that began with the 2008 financial crisis has ended. What follows is unclear.
articles.title: In the Market: US bond market signals the end of an era

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Sam Bankman-Fried will likely defend himself at his fraud trial, due to begin on Tuesday, by arguing he did not think the use by his FTX cryptocurrency exchange of customer funds was improper and by challenging the credibility of those who say otherwise.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's fraud trial: How will he defend himself?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Euro zone manufacturing activity remained mired in a deep and broad-based downturn last month, according to a survey which showed on Monday that demand kept shrinking at a pace rarely surpassed since the data was first collected in 1997.
articles.title: Euro zone factory activity stuck in steep downturn

articles.author: Daniel Leussink
articles.description: Japan's move to bar most used-car sales to Russia slammed the brakes on a trade nearing $2 billion annually that had boomed in the shadow of sanctions over Ukraine elsewhere, according to trade data and market participants.
articles.title: Japan puts the brakes on lucrative used-car trade with Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: OPEC is optimistic on demand and sees under-investment as a risk to energy security, Secretary General Haitham Al Ghais said on Monday at an energy industry event in Abu Dhabi.
articles.title: OPEC optimistic on demand, calls for more oil and gas investment

articles.author: Shivansh Tiwary
articles.description: U.S. new vehicle sales likely rose in the third quarter on improving supply and steady demand, but a strike by autoworkers has muddied the outlook for the "Detroit Three" for the rest of the year, analysts said.
articles.title: US new auto sales likely rose in Q3, but UAW strikes may pose speed bump

articles.author: Adriana Barrera, Stefanie Eschenbacher
articles.description: Mexican state energy company Pemex has received a settlement worth more than $30 million from Vitol, including a $23 million cash payment, over a graft scandal that halted deals with the Swiss-based trader, documents showed and sources with knowledge of the matter confirmed to Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Mexico's Pemex, Vitol reach graft settlement worth more than $30 million -documents, sources

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: EU foreign ministers held their first ever meeting outside the bloc in Ukraine on Monday, a show of support for the country after a pro-Russian candidate won an election in Slovakia and the U.S. Congress omitted funding for Kyiv from a spending bill.
articles.title: EU ministers convene in Ukraine to show support after US, Slovakia wobbles

articles.author: Richard Cowan
articles.description: U.S. House of Representatives Speaker Kevin McCarthy is staring down a threat to his leadership, which could plunge the Republican Party back into a crisis this week, days after dodging a federal government shutdown.
articles.title: US House Speaker McCarthy braces for likely new Republican rebellion

articles.author: Daren Butler
articles.description: Turkey said it unleashed air strikes on militant targets in northern Iraq and detained suspects in Istanbul overnight, hours after Kurdish militants said they orchestrated the first bomb attack in the capital Ankara in years.
articles.title: After Ankara bombing, Turkey hits back in Iraq and at home
